data.reddit:
31 year old female. 5’5” and 135 pounds. Caucasian. Migraines with aura for about 13 years now. I’m take 50mg of sumatriptan for the migraines as needed.
The only other meds I take are xidra for dry eyes and camilla the progresterone only birth control pill. I don’t smoke at all, I do drink alcohol in moderation.

Symptoms changed a little bit about a year ago. My aura spots changed in pattern from looking like snow to looking like shooting stars or pinwheels.
I also see visual halos all the time and have light sensitivity most of the time.

About a year ago I got dizzy for a about 3 months, often feeling dizzy or like the floor was falling out from under me.

But that dizzyness went away for the most part.

I saw a neurologist recently who said he thought my migraine symptoms changing seemed normal and he was more concerned about the past dizziness and to a lesser extent the visual halos (which he said he can’t do anything about...).

He said he’s sure they almost certainly won’t find anything but he wants me to do an mri.
Over a thousand dollars is a lot of money for me to spend.
Is it standard to recommend an MRI for dizzyness that has mostly gone and also visual halos? And is it true that nothing can be done about constant visual halos?

I’ve seen an eye doctor already and my eyes checked out fine (although they are very dry, he gave me xidra for that).

Oh also forgot to mention that my visual auras last much longer than average. If I didn’t take my meds they would last hours or potentially days where it seems most peoples auras last 30 minutes and then it clears and moves to pain. Not sure if that affects whether I should get an mri or not
